blog.title: be like the rocky promontory
blog.description:
Elizabeth (They/Them). 23. White. Nonbinary, ace-spec, queer. Writer 
& history nerd. Unrepentantly bitter critical consumer of media. This blog is meant to be a safe space for any and all marginalized peoples. Fair Warning: This blog is a Mess and All Over The Place ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

tags: i can never decide how to draw crowley’s hair
also yes crowley has little squiggly snake cufflinks
summary: Yes, Crowley definitely is the kind of person to wear a pocket square while unbuttoning the top three buttons of his Oxford, and...
body: Yes, Crowley definitely is the kind of person to wear a pocket square while unbuttoning the top three buttons of his Oxford, and yes, Aziraphale definitely is the kind of person to wear a plaid bow tie with a cardigan.

reblog.comment: Yes, Crowley definitely is the kind of person to wear a pocket square while unbuttoning the top three buttons of his Oxford, and yes, Aziraphale definitely is the kind of person to wear a plaid bow tie with a cardigan.

trail.content_raw: Yes, Crowley definitely is the kind of person to wear a pocket square while unbuttoning the top three buttons of his Oxford, and yes, Aziraphale definitely is the kind of person to wear a plaid bow tie with a cardigan.
trail.content: Yes, Crowley definitely is the kind of person to wear a pocket square while unbuttoning the top three buttons of his Oxford, and yes, Aziraphale definitely is the kind of person to wear a plaid bow tie with a cardigan.

ko-fi | ao3

summary: about aziraphale being fat and old and also the hottest thing crowley has ever known
title: about aziraphale being fat and old and also the hottest thing crowley has ever known
body:
i keep starting and stopping this post in my head, so i’m just gonna write it down. now, i’ll be very clear from the get-go: there is certainly a value in being attracted to a lover’s personality, to the light that shines in their eyes, the soft curve of their lip, the sound of their laugh, the way they hold their hands, the way they say “i love you”, their fastidious and funny little ways, their stupid jokes, etc, etc.

this post is not about that. there’s often a tone re: aziraphale’s weight that kind comes across as, “oh, but crowley is still attracted to him bc of his personality,” like YEAH, that, but also, his body. you don’t need to go, ”oh it’s all about his personality”, like, his body is GREAT 

so, let’s define the aziraphale that i’m talking about here. let’s say, from an average person’s POV, he looks to be in his mid-fifties, which is one thing on its own. like, people can have… wrinkles. these can be sexy. laughter lines, crow’s feet, everpresent dimples. they’re marks of wear and tear, sure, but that’s where the expression is: a smile laid that valley around his mouth; his laughter created those lines at his eyes; his cute little concentrated frown made that furrow in his brow. 

 and he is, shall we say… well-proportioned? he’s fat. that’s what we mean: that’s what we’ll say. he’s fat. this does not, in fact, mean that he’s super skinny, with skinny legs and skinny arms, and like, a slightly rounded belly, no.

he’s meaty. if you start from his shoulders, he will be broader. you won’t see his collarbone from across the room, sharp enough to cut glass. the flesh settles thick on the bones, gives it all the cushioning it needs. his breast is not all that flat: it’s warm and fat and pillowy on each side, and then he has the round curve to his belly. but the thing is, like… when you’re chubby and you have that rounded form, it isn’t just a little curve in the front: it’s heavy on the sides, too, and cushions the hips.

because of the way our bodies gather fat, you’re not gonna have two straight lines for legs: aziraphale’s thighs will be super generously proportioned, but his calves will be less so, and most of the fat will land around his seat - his arse (it’s absolutely a fat arse, o yes), and the tops of his thighs. his arms will have the same kind of thing - they’ll be thicker in the upper arm than in the forearm. there’ll also probably be more wobble to the thighs and the upper arms than to the calves and to the forearms.

and his hands!!! plump hands! so soft! 

there’s a tendency, when it comes to bodies that are fat, to avert the gaze. we look away, because there’s this overwhelming narrative of thin bodies being the only good bodies, and we’re subsequently quite uncomfortable with bodies that aren’t slender or like, muscled. bc there’s that conditioning to look away from fat bodies, to see them as ugly or inherently unhealthy, when neither is true whatsoever, we also tend to desexualise fat bodies, and i defo think that that’s maybe part of the reason there’s that big thing of like, focusing on aziraphale as thinner and conventionally handsome. 

crowley does not have that tendency. he does not look at aziraphale’s body and think that he should be thinner. crowley’s lifetime has spanned a multitude of epochs, and the connotations of aziraphale’s body might have been calculated to deter any mortals that might want to come onto him, but they sure as fuck can’t deter crowley. 

listen. 

aziraphale’s body is hefty. it’s meaty. 

it’s a body that says, in a language far older than magazines and television and advertisements for not-meals, “yes, i eat and drink and i lead a life of indolence, bc i can.” his hands are soft and plump and pretty: aziraphale doesn’t work outside, doesn’t labour and doesn’t toil. he does soft, inside work, and he’s genteel. his body is fat and pillowy: crowley can reach out and grab fistfuls of his lovehandles, feel the flesh yield beneath his touch; he can playfully smack aziraphale’s thigh, watch it jiggle and quake under the light blow; he can feel aziraphale’s weight on him, pinning him down no matter how strong he really is. when he smiles, there are dimples: his cheeks are round and rosy, his lips are plump. 

when crowley lies on him, he radiates warmth, and he’s never cold: he’s soft and comfortable, and when he hugs crowley, he surrounds him. 

like, if you jump back about 500, 1000 years, 1500 years, AND FURTHER, aziraphale is a fucking catch. he’s fat - means he’s rich, means he doesn’t work outside too much! yes, he’s got a few years on him, but that just means he won’t run off and fuck around elsewhere! he’s got soft hands, a warm body, a warmer bed, no doubt, and like, listen, he’s got all his own teeth and everything!

aziraphale can be fat and old and sexy!

(and he is! crowley will say so!)

tags: i'M SORRY i had several drafts im done posting for now
summary: crowley, knowing everyone usually assumes aziraphale is his sugar daddy, showing off at the ritz, romancing aziraphale, pulling...
body:
crowley, knowing everyone usually assumes aziraphale is his sugar daddy, showing off at the ritz, romancing aziraphale, pulling his chair out for him, ordering his drinks for him, dipping him when he kisses him, in general acting like aziraphale is his favourite sugar baby: i am daddy call me daddy
aziraphale, sceptically: daddy?
crowley: oh daddy no don't do that

dialogue.name: crowley, knowing everyone usually assumes aziraphale is his sugar daddy, showing off at the ritz, romancing aziraphale, pulling his chair out for him, ordering his drinks for him, dipping him when he kisses him, in general acting like aziraphale is his favourite sugar baby

dialogue.phrase: i am daddy call me daddy

blog.name: ineffableplan
blog.title: That Hieronymus Bosch. What a weirdo.
blog.description: A Good Omens side-blog. | Mostly running on the queue. | Ask to tag | I tag for #lemon, so you may block it | About Discord server invites for mobile | I'm usually known as Socks, they/them, 20-something, just here for the laughs | Posts are okay to add to and I like hearing other people's headcanons and opinions, they're fun

tags: crowley would cry watching bambi and thats my take
summary: #does crowley dislike sad stories yes, because he always has to cry watching/reading/hearing them
question: #does crowley dislike sad stories yes, because he always has to cry watching/reading/hearing them
answer:
Oh poor snek…

I’ve been thinking about this, and how it fits in with the way Crowley doesn’t dwell on things? Crowley is all “it’s not that bad” over his own situations, even when those situations are traumatic. I don’t think he likes to pay attention to things that bring him down.

His coping methods, when he is distressed, tend to be about distraction. The movies he likes have the hero winning.

He doesn’t even dwell very hard on the destruction of his Bentley after the fact, beyond a resigned acknowledgment.

If he can’t improve a situation, he doesn’t want to look at it.

summary:
i am so ready for queen blasting through the speakers of crowley’s fire-engulfed bentley as he flies through the streets.
don’t...

don’t stop me now…

tags: idk if u have gleaned this
but i'm emo about greenhouses and i Love Them
summary: let crowley have a greenhouse. let him grow plants underneath the glass panes, the sun shining down on luscious, verdant leaves,...
body:
let crowley have a greenhouse.

let him grow plants underneath the glass panes, the sun shining down on luscious, verdant leaves, the scent of the air like ozone: let him remember what eden was, surrounded on every side by viridian splendour, the scent of heat and air and mulch and blossom thick on his tongue. let him stand, at times, in the middle of it all, leaning against his potting table, feeling naught more than the warmth of a sun he once knew millennia ago, the first time it kissed black scales and gave him a scant sliver of the warmth he knew with the Host

let him have his greenhouse.

let him love in it, and laugh in it: let him whisper dark threats to tomatoes and cucumbers, let him murmur evil words to the leaves of pepper plants, let him leave burning words on the skin of every chilli, that it grows riper and heavier with every day that passes.

let him stand in his greenhouse when the rain is falling, so that he can close his eyes and hear the thunder of every drop upon the glass panes, and feel, for just a moment, as if the world is ending.

and let aziraphale come up behind him, press a kiss to his shoulder, and say, “come inside, dear. it’s getting late.”

let him leave his eden behind him, every night, and follow the angel where he leads.

title: Drabble
body:
Characters: Crowley x Reader 

Warnings: Death of a character 

Words: 202

“Go kill yourself.”

Three words you’ll always regret. It was the last thing you ever told him and you’ll have to live the rest of your life with that pain on your heart.

Your relationship with Crowley’s always been strange and hard to understand. You loved him… You loved him so much it was too hard to live with it sometimes. You often fought. You often patch up. But lately, it’s been worse. And the last time you saw him, you had this very big fight.

And those three words left your mouth.

“Go kill yourself.”

How you regretted it. So much, it hurts.

But now, he was dead and you couldn’t take it back. You couldn’t tell him how much he annoyed you but that you’ll always love him anyway. You couldn’t excuse yourself, you couldn’t tell him that you regretted saying it in the first place.

And he can’t look at you with soft eyes. He won’t open his arms to you, and he won’t engulf you in a warm hug, murmuring in your ear how much he loved you. He can’t now. He can’t tell you he forgives you and he loves you.

And he’ll never be able to.

FOREVER LIST

@dekahg @ria132love @emiwrites3reads @luciferstempest

Sequel to Paradise Thwarted (nine years later!). Crowley is bored again. He really should know better by now. (Or, the crossover no one wanted or asked for).

tags: I personally kind of always thought that they both changed
but I'll read it again and think about it :)
(I've been thinking about it and I definitely agree that Aziraphale changed more)
summary: From SXSW panel: Neil: Crowley actually is really smart and he’s the same character. He goes through, you know, an awful lot,...
caption:
From SXSW panel:

Neil: Crowley actually is really smart and he’s the same character. He goes through, you know, an awful lot, but he’s the same person at the beginning on the wall at the Garden of Eden as he really is at the end of the story. Aziraphale actually has to change. He’s like somebody who for years has just been such part of a group, part of a political party, part of something that he kind of believes and trusts, and now he’s starting to realize that actually that… we fucked… he actually has much more painful journey. He makes more mistakes. Crowley knows how appaling Hell is, so that never really changes for him, and he knows that he likes being on Earth. He is against the Armageddon from the word go. He thinks the world is great and is comfortable and it has restaurants and wine; it has a few strange things, you know, he’s never been able to get anything other that The Best of Queen to play in a radio. It’s a great place to be. Aziraphale kind of knows that, but he also believes that they Heaven and Gabriel, they kind of know what they’re doing - don’t they? So he’s the one that goes through the journey.

Interviewer: Crowley has lived a life of bravery. I mean, if it’s a metaphor for a human existence, he’s the guy who put himself out there, he’s fallen down, he’s got back up, he knows what it feels like to be alive. Aziraphale’s lived a very guarded life and as a result he fears, you know, with the good and the bad so he really is a metaphor for the rest of us trying to figure out who we are.

David: Yes, ‘cause Crowley was once an angel too, remember. He’s an angel who fell from grace, so he knows he’s amongst wankers to begin with. It is really about… dealing and surviving and if only he could make the scales fall from his mate’s eyes they’d be in a much better possition.

summary: THE J STANDS FOR JANELLE MONAE
title: THE J STANDS FOR JANELLE MONAE
body:
I must write a fic based loosely on the premise of Make Me Feel immediately

And by immediately I mean in about three months once I’m not frantically packing for my holiday, cramming a coursework deadline, trying to do continued professional development balls, working a nine day week until my holiday and then cramming for an exam I didn’t even realise I was actually having but I will be thinking about this concept every spare moment until then

summary: btw does anyone know if there's a specific reason as to why crowley's eyes seem to... change? like, they're completely yellow in...
body:
btw does anyone know if there’s a specific reason as to why crowley’s eyes seem to… change? like, they’re completely yellow in eden

but his sclera (or a big part of it) turns white at the air base

is this symbolism? a continuity error? contact lenses deciding they had enough?

reblog.comment:
btw does anyone know if there’s a specific reason as to why crowley’s eyes seem to… change? like, they’re completely yellow in eden

but his sclera (or a big part of it) turns white at the air base

is this symbolism? a continuity error? contact lenses deciding they had enough?

title: Glad I found you
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2JdAZRN

by FangirlingUntilIdie

Dean works so that Sam can go to an elite school, but the younger brother doesn’t know just how far Dean will go to ensure a good future for him. Along the way, Dean finds love in an unexpected place.

Words: 710, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Supernatural
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Rape/Non-Con, Underage
  • Categories: M/M, Multi
  • Characters: Dean Winchester, Castiel (Supernatural), Sam Winchester, Crowley (Supernatural)
  • Relationships: Castiel/Dean Winchester
  • Additional Tags: Sex Worker Dean Winchester, Drugs
